page.title: 10NEWHALL YOUTH HOSTEL
page.content: { Newhall Youth Hostel}has 24 mentally handicapped residents all over 18. They have individual bedrooms but 2 residents live in a flat on the side of the Hostel. Here they cook meals, clean, wash & generally take care of themselves trying to live as we do. {The Hostel is divided into units: 1. {Transitional Unit,}where 4 residents learn to share & look after themselves;{2. Special Care Unit, where residents who can't look after themselves are cared for;{3. Middle {Unit,}which is 2 storeys where short term residents live. They play darts, records & dominoes; do jigsaws; are taken for walks; have talks & use the nearby school's playing field. The residents work at the{Adult Training {Centre}but only earn 25p-Â£1 a day depending on their abilities. They do woodwork, metalwork, cooking & art.
